article.description:
Rafael Araujo scored a game-high 19 points and
grabbed 13 rebounds to lead No. 2 seed BYU past No. 7 New Mexico
71-56 in the first round of the Mountain West Tournament Thursday.
article.headline: BYU holds Douglas in check in Lobos' loss
article.linkText: Araujo's big effort helps BYU defeat New Mexico
article.story: ALBUQUERQUE (AP) -- Javin Tindall's 17 points and seven assists led the Lobos to a 75-71 exhibition win Sunday over EA Sports Southwest All-Stars. Mark Walters added 16 points for the Lobos, and forward Alfred Neale had 10 points and 10 rebounds. David Chiotti had 10 points and nine rebounds. Tindall hit six of 10 shots from the floor, including three of six 3-pointers. Koko Archibong sank eight of 10 for a total of 19 points for EA Sports. New Mexico led 40-33 at halftime. The Lobos outrebounded the visitors 45-35.
